dialogue.raw_text: Let me through. I fought the King's battle too. He must know my story.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chaos... confusion... brutes... savages... troglodytes... Stand back... make space.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The moon... the sun... the stars... they spin... they turn... they circle... around us... us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You, and you, and you, take up your place. Be wedded to the world. Respect its perfection. All of you, together, be one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your ancient wisdom and infinite sight have forged this circle, Merlin. Hereafter we shall come together in a circle, to tell and hear of deeds good and brave. I will build a table where this fellowship shall meet. And a hall around the table. And a castle about the hall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I will marry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And the land will have an heir to wield Excalibur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Knights of the Round Table, good friends, brothers in arms. I send you on a quest harder by far than the battles we have fought together, a quest to uphold always, and everywhere, justice, honor, and truth. Each day shall bring forth a cause, and may each cause bring forth a knight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I swear never to rest twice on the same pillow till all men live at peace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Terrified women, a screaming child, cowering men, old or made old by the hard labor of the fields. Armored men are ransacking a farm, looking for grain, and gold which they find among the votive objects of a little house altar. A woman is dragged away to be raped. Through a window, a knight in shining armor is seen emerging from the adjoining woods. The plunderers are all of a sudden apprehensive, and fall silent. One of them grabs the crying child and covers her mouth with his iron hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The knight is Lancelot, in his mirror-like armor. He rides into the cluster of houses and barns that make up the farm. There are other armored men there, around a cart half-loaded with loot. They smile nervously at Lancelot. The farmers are blank with fear. Lancelot stops in the middle of the yard. A knight among the armored men comes forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he also acknowledges with a nod the ashen-faced patriarch of the community. Lancelot spurs his horse on, and the knight sighs with relief. But then he reins his horse to a stop. He has sensed something. He turns his head, his hooded eyes on the knight and his men, and they squirm inwardly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good day, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good day to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The child, her mouth covered by the armored hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot, listening, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The woman, a blade flashing next to her eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot, immobile. Behind him, the knight, his face shiny with sweat. His minions inch forward, hands moving slowly toward sword hilts. Lancelot wheels his horse around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a shout the knight and his men draw their swords and rush Lancelot. He reins in his horse, causing it to rear and break their attack. He slides off, falling on his feet with sword drawn, already fighting. In an extraordinary show of sword play he cuts down six men.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I hear the stifled cry for help, I smell the reek of fear...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hearing Lancelot storm in, the man holding the child hands her to a woman and kneels before the altar, just as Lancelot bursts into the room, sword high and already swooping down on the man's neck. Lancelot brings the sword to a halt mid- air, his fury held in check. The repent man is spared. The woman kneels to kiss Lancelot's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The field is pitched with war tents and pavilions decked for holiday. Nobles and knights flank the King and Guenevere, a beautiful vision in white samite, a wreath of flowers around her head. Lancelot leads a long file of prisoners to the King. They fall to their knees, begging forgiveness; among them is the man whom Lancelot had spared before the altar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rises and follows Arthur and Guenevere into the central pavilion. Pages draw its curtains closed as they pass inside.
direction.name: direction

location: SITE OF THE SWORD IN THE STONE
result.heading: EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: These men repented before God for their evil deeds. Those who would not, met their fate at the end of my sword. (he kneels) Accept the fruit of my first quest as my wedding gift.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do. Rise, Lancelot, come with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Guenevere is surrounded by a group of ladies and maids who fuss over her dress and her hair. They eye the great knight and whisper about him, Guenevere laughing with them. Arthur sits, excited and happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot sits, stiff and upright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guenevere overhears. She approaches and Lancelot jumps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin leans close to Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rises. Lancelot, who was about to sit again, straightens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Merlin exit, leaving Guenevere and Lancelot. She looks at him, lively and amused, and he can't help smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guenevere smiles, moved by his blunt innocence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kneels, kisses her thigh, rises and leaves.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Sit beside me, Lancelot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your deeds set an example for all other knights. For your gift, ask a gift of me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only give me leave to ride out again, to do what I am most able to do, and happiest doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Arthur) He must stay for the feasting days of our wedding, and tell his deeds himself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Lancelot, smiling) I grant you your wish if you grant Lady Guenevere hers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will stay Madame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The knights of Galys approach the camp. It would be politic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...to ride out and meet them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will ride with Sir Kay. Lancelot, rest here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't start a war on my wedding day!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Without Lancelot?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look Lancelot. The maids and ladies whisper about you. They all dream of winning you, young and old, fair and ugly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But surely that's no secret to you, dear Lancelot. You're the bravest and strongest knight they've ever seen, and beauty has kissed your brow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The well-kept secret is whether any of them has won your heart.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am a fighting man and I am married to the quest. That is enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And there is no maiden in the whole world who inspires you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. I would swear my love to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: To me? But why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot love as a woman the lady who will be wife to my King and my friend. And, in pledging my love to you, I cannot love any other woman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will see you in all women, and I will defend them as I would defend you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A chorus of children sings. The Bishop waits at the altar with his friars and altar boys. Cornucopias overflowing with vegetables and wildflowers adorn the church, which glows with the light of a thousand candles. Sir Kay is satisfied. He comes back up the petal-strewn aisle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Guenevere are ushered in by Kay. They are flanked by Leondegrance and Sir Ector. Lancelot and Merlin follow, leading the cortege of knights and ladies. Merlin is incapable of entering the chapel, as if at the threshold there is an unseen force that repels him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strangling a laugh he wrenches himself away. Just then Uryens and a small party of knights rides up through the tents and dismounts in front of the church. Uryens helps a lady off her horse and joins the cortege on foot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin, who was slinking away through the throng of bystanders, looks up. What he sees sends a chill through his body. At Uryens' side stands a young woman of sinister beauty, with bewitching eyes of ice. Merlin just stares at her, and she smiles back at him faintly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin laughs. Uryens shrugs and continues into the chapel with Morgana. As she enters she glances back, and just then Merlin steals a look, their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

location: CHAPEL, SITE OF THE SWORD IN THE STONE
result.heading: EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Merlin, are you ill?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, I need air.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merlin, don't you join the celebration?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My wife, Merlin. Lady Morgana of Cornwall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remember you, Merlin. I was a child. You took my brother away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Uryens and Morgana take their places near the altar. Arthur and Guenevere kneel before the Bishop, and Arthur takes her hand. The clatter of armor mingles with the enthusiastic, happy singing of the children, and seems to strengthen their song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chorus carries across the field to the dark wall of trees from which issues another chorus, of hoots and squawks and howls. Merlin advances along the edge of the forest. He stops by the stone that once held the sword, his eyes wild. He forgets his inner torment when he sees a plant at the base of the stone. He kneels beside it and plucks it. He admires its strange flowers; he smells them. Two feet appear at his side. He rises to be face to face with Morgana. They look deep into each other. Then Merlin breaks the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin smiles at last, and Morgana does, her eyes piercing, cruel and lovely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His gaze drifts toward the chapel.
direction.name: direction

location: SITE OF THE SWORD IN THE STONE
result.heading: EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: You left your husband's side? You left your brother's wedding?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that Mandrake, Lord Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can it truly be used for magic?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... sometimes...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...There are many powers in this world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Guenevere are radiant with joy, and Lancelot behind them mirrors the ceremony of their joining in his armor; and the sweet voices of the children fill the chapel as the Bishop pours the wine into the chalice, and lifts it up before him, blessing it. He turns to the royal couple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The chalice seems to burn with a mystical light; and as the chorus soars:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Drink this the blood of Jesus Christ our Lord.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : "And Arthur built his castle, Camelot. And one day, in the far reaches of the Kingdom..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is shadowy and dark; ancient trees creak, unseen animals cry out. A rabbit hops into view and a boy leaps forward, grabbing the animal by the ears before it can move. He-- Perceval--is a wild boy of seventeen, dressed in skins with an endearing and childlike smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A din is heard to the forest, and it grows. Perceval glances around, panicked. The sound is the rubbing of leather upon leather, of metal on metal, for now a mounted figure in armor hovers over the terrified boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lets the rabbit go free. The threatening figure dismounts. And Perceval, cartwheels backward, landing in the stream and scooping a fish out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He returns the fish to the water. The figure steps into a pool of sunlight and a glorious halo streaks from the armor. It is Lancelot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval is overcome with astonishment, and he kneels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot laughs and pulls the boy to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval is beside himself with enthusiasm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot rolls his eyes, amused.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the rabbit) Sorry. Hungry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stuttering) Have I taken too much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (desperately trying to ingratiate) I had rabbit yesterday. Today I'll eat fish... No?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be afraid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're an angel! Not a devil...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a man. A knight in the King's service.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a man?! (he reaches out to touch Lancelot) ...with metal skin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can I grow metal skin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You've got a lot to learn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lancelot is cantering and Perceval is running alongside, shouting in gasps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot shakes his head and spurs the horse into a gallop. Perceval lengthens his stride, and keeps up! Lancelot reins to a halt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll learn... take me... to the King... What's a... King?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Very well. Climb up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will run.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, boy, it's more than twenty days from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Twenty days!? The world is that big?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Perceval cannot believe his eyes. As Lancelot and Kay talk about him out of earshot, he sees things that he's never seen before; and he gapes like the country bumpkin that he is. Dragon-like kites sweep low, maneuvered by children. In a meadow among the trees, knights hone their skills with lance and sword, and ladies watch and their "bright eyes rain influence and judge the prize." And then, there is Camelot itself; the great gate and the drawbridge; the massive walls, and the soaring towers and spires above. Perceval rushes up to Lancelot and Kay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay is not at all pleased; nonetheless he takes the boy by the ear and leads him across the drawbridge and into the castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot smiles to himself, hesitation, lingering before the great gate of Camelot. There is a walkway suspended in the trees above, that also leads to the castle, and promenading on it is a group of women, Guenevere and her ladies-in-waiting. The Queen sees Lancelot and hastens toward him. Lancelot sees her, and mounts his horse and heads back into the forest. She stops, somewhat ahead of the ladies, and watches wistfully. Lancelot turns back and seeing her one last time, draws down his visor and spurs his horse into a canter. He passes two commoners who are heading for the castle, one fat and the other thin, and they are locked in hot dispute. Their wives keep them from coming to blows and their children spur them on, enjoying the excitement. Lancelot is swallowed by the forest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who will give me my sword?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kitchen knives and greasy spits will be your weapons, boy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Guenevere, bearing a bowl of perfect, deep red apples, approaches the Round Table, where Arthur sits and Merlin at his side, attending to the affairs of the kingdom. Quite a few of the knights occupy their seats, talking with each other, drinking and laughing, attended by ladies and pages. Guenevere places the apples at Lancelot's empty place and takes her seat next to Arthur. In the archways that lead into the hall, petitioners wait, eating, drinking, talking among themselves. In the din, no one pays attention to the vehement arguing of the fat man and the thin man, which continues even here. The hall is the burgeoning, happy center of the kingdom. But Merlin is oblivious to the lively clamor. He gazes like a lovesick puppy across the table at Morgana, who bends over whispering to a knight at the table, the young Sir Gahalt,, while his older brother Sir Gawain listens. Morgana notices Merlin's stare and smiles at him, and then resumes her flirtation with Sir Gahalt, much to Merlin's annoyance. Sir Kay ushers the thin man and the fat man into the open space at the center of the table for their audience with the king. They quarrel even as Kay tries to present them, and the attention of the hall gradually focuses on them. The two men talk at once, interrupting, overlapping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I brew ale, sir--from old shoes--I am an honest tradesman sir. I must sell what I produce. He won't buy ale and he won't pay. Pay up! He leans over the barrel and sucks in the vapors. The vapors are mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How would you know I, sir, have the misfortune to live next to this criminal... What loss in that? Not to me! Pay for what? Why?! They are floating on the wind. Arthur is both amused and exasperated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur addresses the Thin Man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Thin Man is crestfallen, the smile gone from his face. He reluctantly hands the coins to Kay, who gives them to Arthur. Arthur tosses them in the air and lets them fall on a metal plate. He hands them back to the Thin Man, who is totally confused now, as is everybody else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The knights roar with laughter and the Fat Man and the Thin Man look at each other in astonishment. Perceval lets out a raucous laugh that wins him a glance of disapproval from Kay.
direction.name: direction

location: HALL OF THE ROUND TABLE, CAMELOT
result.heading: INT.

dialogue.raw_text: Enough!... What is a fair price for the smell of your ale?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's why we have come to you, sir There's no one else who can tell us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What does it cost to get drunk on your ale?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At least three shillings, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me three shillings.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For the smell of your ale, the jingle of his coins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The din of the petitioners is replaced by music. It is the hour of the evening feast, and all knights are present, except Lancelot. Whole tree trunks burn in the great fireplace, and lambs roast on spits in the flames. Pages run to and fro with trays of food and wine, Perceval among them. Morgana stops beside Merlin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin is in agony, a bug stuck on a pin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She does, laughing and in complete control. His hand immediately slides onto her thigh. She removes it, but holds it in her hand, toying with his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin looks at her, knowing already, sad yet eager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin's thoughts have carried him far away, when he realizes that Arthur is addressing him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some knights laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur is taken aback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He chuckles softly and Arthur is puzzled. A knight speaks out, the young knight with whom Morgana was flirting. His manner is sarcastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hall falls silent, all eyes upon the Queen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Frightened, Gahalt doesn't answer. Morgana has slipped to Guenevere's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur, ashen-faced, turns to Merlin for help, but he has escaped into sleep...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morgana picks the bowl up and as she does so, unseen by any and with a magician's dexterity, she thrusts her fingernails deep into the top apple. She gives the bowl to Guenevere, who takes it and sweeps around to where Sir Gahalt sits, followed by Morgana. The young knight jumps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is too shy to take the shiniest, most beautiful apple on top, and goes for another one. Morgana giggles, and he looks at her. She looks at the apple on top and then smiles encouragingly at him. Sir Gahalt takes it and starts eating as the Queen returns to her seat. With the third bite his is unable to breathe. His face goes red and he rises to his feet, attempting to call out. He falls, dying immediately. All leap to their feet, and Arthur rushes to the young knight. Merlin is asleep and far from human affairs. Arthur and Sir Gawain rise from the body of the young knight. Sir Gawain backs away from Arthur and points at Guenevere, trembling with cold rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guenevere, white and with a broken voice, turns to Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She begins to swoon and Morgana keeps her steady on her feet. Arthur slumps into his seat and Sir Gawain kneels before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enraged, Arthur reaches for Excalibur. But with effort he checks his impulse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur cannot look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one responds. Guenevere falls into her seat. Arthur searches the eyes of his knights and they evade him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The knight looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Ector, old and feeble, weeps for Arthur. Someone speaks up. It is Perceval, who kneels before the Queen. His voice is unnaturally loud, and his eyes shine with held-back tears; he stutters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is overwhelmed by his own boldness. He looks around. All eyes are upon him. Guenevere smiles at him, sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval hurries from the hall. Arthur looks away, ashamed, and his eyes fall on Merlin, twitching and mumbling in his sleep.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What did I see today in the wizard's eyes? Censure, because I enjoy a few words with a young handsome knight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no, of course not. You are young...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not jealous!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's clear you are, and it irks me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Yes, I am. I am jealous. I want to write poems about you with moonbeams, make the sea sing your name...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A lovestruck page!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shh... yes, yes. Sit with me, please... Morgana.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A steamy, panting, lovestruck page. But what good are songs and poems to me? They are the barter of ordinary love. A gift that reflected your greatness is the only one worthy of your love.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I showed you all my conjuring tricks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The deepest secrets, the forbidden formulas...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe... maybe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merlin, are you counselor to the King, or to my sister?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At your service, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then answer me this. For years peace has reigned in the land. Crops grow in abundance, there is no want. Every one of my subjects enjoys his portion of happiness and justice, even those whose tiresome misunderstandings we must resolve here each day. Tell me, Merlin: have we defeated evil, as it seems?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good and evil; there is never one without the other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where hides evil, then, in my kingdom?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Never where you expect it, that's all I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If we have peace and justice, why is Lancelot never with us? Why is he always riding out on his quests? He must know where this evil is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Could there be evil within Lancelot himself? To live above human folly, as is his aim, is to be overly proud.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He pays no heed even to the Queens longing for his company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (lashing out) What is it you would have your words mean, Sir Gahalt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't listen to him. You are the Queen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir Gahalt, answer the Queen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. I meant not to be angry with you, Sir Gahalt. In the idleness that comes with peace gossip has bread its own evil. You merely repeat it. Please, sir, have one of those apples that Lancelot loves, and in that gesture partake of its goodness.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take one, Sir Gahalt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am most honored, my lady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hear me, Lord Arthur, and knights and chieftains: I charge Guenevere with the murder of my brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't... I am innocent.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I champion this truth: That Queen Guenevere murdered Sir Gahalt with the aid of sorcery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Queen will be in my charge till a champion steps forward to fight on her behalf.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not you, my husband?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She must be burnt at the stake. That is the sentence for murder done with magic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is. Lords and knights of the Round Table, as her husband I say that this deed was not done by Guenevere. Who among you will champion this truth?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir Caradoc! You!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am torn.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will champion you, my lady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thank you, but you are not yet a knight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will find Lancelot! He will come!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boys!... boys will be boys...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In full armor but for his helmet, Lancelot is seated at a small table in the shadow of a tree, eating an apple. A young girl is turning a chicken on a spit, and her mother is removing freshly-baked bread from an oven. It is very peaceful and silent until, galloping all out, Perceval arrives. Frantic, out of breath, he leaps from his lathered horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two women set the chicken and the bread before the great knight, and stand back to watch him eat, flushed with excitement. Perceval falls silent, in awe of Lancelot.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have found you. The Queen. An apple. Tomorrow. Sir Gawain...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --It must wait, child. These good ladies, for whom I intervened once, will honor me with a meal. I am beholden to them now as I was when they begged my protection.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur stands hunched over the fireplace, staring into the flames. Guenevere paces back and forth to a window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hides his anguish from her. Numb with hurt, she goes to a tall curtained window, and draws it open, and stands there looking out upon the surrounding forest, silent and still beneath the moon.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't you be my champion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I am your judge, I cannot be your champion. When I act as your King, I cannot be your husband.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you cannot love me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The laws, my laws, must bind everyone, high and low, or they are not laws at all. Lancelot will come...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And if he cannot be found, no other knight will champion me, though you beseeched each and every one of them. Why be king if there is no one you can call loyal subject but an eager boy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She cries softly, and she whispers the name of the great knight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A mounted knight stands motionless at the edge of the forest, his armor gleaming with dark lustre. It is Lancelot. His eyes are raised to the high window, where he sees Guenevere. He watches her in silence. In the high window Guenevere draws the curtain and Lancelot reins back into the forest.
direction.name: direction

location: EDGE OF THE FOREST, WALLS OF CAMELOT
result.heading: EXT.

direction.raw_text: Lancelot has unsaddled and tethered his horse in a small clearing. He sits, resting back against a tree. He removes his helmet; he plants his sword before him, like a cross. He loosens the ties of his breastplate. He waits for day, yawning, tired. But his eyes burn, and he closes them and nods off to sleep. A knight appears silently hovering over him. Lancelot looks up, and his eyes go wide with fear. The knight towering above him wears armor identical to his, and he raises his sword, and the blade is descending upon Lancelot. Lancelot draws his sword from the ground and rolls away, but the knight's sword slices through his shoulder joint. Lancelot attempts to rise but already the knight, Lancelot's mirror image, is upon him. From the ground, Lancelot parries the blow and slashes at the opponent's knee, cutting through the joint in the armor and severing the leg. The knight doesn't fall, doesn't bleed, doesn't cry out. On one leg he comes forward, a horror. Lancelot is paralyzed by fear. As the knight leaps upon Lancelot, Lancelot rises to meet him, impaling himself on the knight's sword below the hauberk. He throws the knight to the ground, and comes down upon him. He rips off the helmet and the breastplate. The armor is empty and Lancelot rolls over on his back, awakening from the nightmare with his own sword deep in his stomach, and in his hand his own helmet and breastplate, while other parts of his armor lie strewn around him. Only then does he become conscious of the terrible pain and the shock of the truth. He grabs the hilt of his sword and draws it from his stomach. He curls up in agony, clutching a fistful of leaves to the wound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He loses consciousness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Guenevere, I fight against myself...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Bishop blesses the field. Guenevere, numb and disbelieving, is being led to the stake, which rises from a bed of straw and wood. Arthur watches, in shock. Other knights and ladies keep their distance, watching darkly, stealing glances at Arthur, mumbling disapproval of his refusing to defend Guenevere. In battle dress, Sir Gawain rides up and down the jousting run on a snorting and powerful horse, practicing. Perceval, in a mail doublet, waits beside a mangy roan, his face burning with anxiety. Guenevere is tied to the stake. All eyes watch for the approach of her champion. Arthur goes to Perceval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur hides his pain behind a rigid mask.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Is he coming?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He heard Lady Guenevere's request and he said nothing. That is all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The sun has risen shining cruelly into Guenevere's eyes; the queen is alone at the stake. Sir Gawain rides up to King Arthur, who waits alone, separated from the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval leaps onto his horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Gawain looks at the squire with contempt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur is in anguish. He searches the tree line for a sign of Lancelot. He looks from Guenevere at the stake to his own knights watching him. He draws Excalibur. A gasp goes through the crowd of onlookers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval leaps from his horse and bends his knee before the King. Arthur brings the sword down on the boy's shoulder, giving him the three strokes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gawain shakes his head disdainfully as Perceval mounts back into the saddle, his eyes burning with fervor. Sir Gawain and Perceval ride to opposite ends of the field. The spectators fall silent, all staring blankly, their senses dulled by the tragedy, at the uneven combatants. A cry goes up. Lancelot rides out of the forest. He rides up to the King and salutes him. Arthur smiles at his old friend, tears of joy in his eyes. Lancelot bows toward Guenevere and rides on to where Perceval waits. Lancelot reaches out to touch Perceval's cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval cannot reply, his eyes affixed on the blood that trickles from Lancelot's hauberk. Lancelot raises his lance in salute to Gawain across the field. Gawain salutes in answer. The two huge knights charge at each other, each man's spear tip making contact with the other's armor, and in the violent collision both are unhorsed. Lancelot is slower at getting to his feet and drawing his sword. He is bleeding below the hauberk from his self-inflicted wound. In the first onslaught Lancelot fights defensively, falling back. He has to toss aside his shield and hold his stomach with his shield hand. Morgana watches with Merlin. Every terrible blow of sword on sword reverberates through her body pleasurable. Merlin is captivated by her cruel sensuality.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: My Lord, the sun is upon the field. The Queen has no champion. I demand justice, as is my right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me champion the Queen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Arthur) Since no knight comes forward, I demand justice--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Boy, kneel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In the name of God, of St. Michael, and St. George, I make you a knight. Rise, Sir...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Perceval!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's my task to prove the Queen's innocence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They swing and thrust at each other with slower but bone- crushing force, both unsteady now. Blood seeps from Lancelot's feet, leaving awful footprints on the earth. Finally, with a daring thrust, Lancelot lifts Gawain's visor and the sword tip is before his eyes. Gawain drops his sword and shield, kneels and speaks in a voice hoarse with weariness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot collapses in a dead faint.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Queen is innocent. I yield to your mercy, Sir Lancelot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Eyes closed, Lancelot lies on a bed, naked but for a cloth across his loins. His minor wounds have been dressed, and Merlin is kneading the huge gash in his stomach, working the severed flesh together. Guenevere stands on one side of the bed, Arthur on the other, both looking down upon Lancelot, relieved and not daring to look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guenevere kneels, and at her touch Lancelot's eyes flicker open. Merlin exits, and draws Arthur away with him. Arthur is deeply tormented.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin appears moved by the predicaments that Arthur has to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin stares off into the evening sky, where a lark sings high up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He taps his skull and smiles.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Flesh on flesh. You must press on the wound, Guenevere, hold it, and it will begin to bind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merlin, tell me. Now that Guenevere is returned to me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it my child?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Will I have a son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just yes? No mad laughter, no riddles, nothing but a simple yes? That frightens me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A king should be afraid, always. The enemy is everywhere. Waiting in ambush in the dark corridors of his castle, on the deer paths of his forest, or in the gray and winding paths of a more tangled forest, in here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lancelot is staring into Guenevere's eyes. She opens her shift, baring a breast with the innocence of a mother preparing to suckle a child. She presses her breast to his wound, her face to his chest, her arms enfolding him. She whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His body trembles and his eyes brim with tears. He is lost.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Flesh on flesh. I will heal you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The court is assembled, for the evening feast. There is music and heavy drinking. Some knights are slouched across the table. Lancelot, still weak, takes his seat, looking at the drunken and frivolous knights. Arthur catches it, and they smile at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guenevere cannot tear her eyes from Lancelot. He avoids her look. Arthur looks from Guenevere to Lancelot, and speaks softly to him, across her, and with stabbing directness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, addressing the hall:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is bent close to Morgana, whispering. Only when the hall rings with laughter does he look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin looks from Arthur to Guenevere to Lancelot to Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An uneasy silence falls upon the feast. Guenevere and Lancelot cannot look at each other, and Arthur feels it. Lancelot jumps to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guenevere stifles her dismay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur is about to rise to embrace him, but checks himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The exchange has become closely intimate, even though they stand apart and speak before everyone in the large hall. Lancelot leaves. Only Guenevere cannot watch.
direction.name: direction

location: HALL OF THE ROUND TABLE, CAMELOT
result.heading: INT.

dialogue.raw_text: They miss the battlefield. I think we do too.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But one can still keep a sword sharp riding out in the name of the King's law.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is not easy for the young ones to learn knightly virtues without the hard teaching of war and quest. It is only your example, Lancelot, that binds them now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which is the greatest quality of knighthood? Courage? Compassion? Loyalty? Humility? What do you say, Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What? (then seeing he has an audience) The greatest? They blend together like the metals we mix to make a good sword.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't ask for poetry. Which is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. Truth. It must be truth, above all. When a man lies he murders some part of the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Conversation and court life don't suit me. I must take my rest in the forest.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hasn't Merlin mended your wound?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is deep...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You will be sorely missed. Heal yourself and come back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Water gurgles from a rock that is captive in the roots of an ancient oak. Lancelot, in armor, reclines against its trunk, the roots cradling him. He is perfectly still, drawing life from the vibrant, all-enfolding forest. Flower petals drift on the breeze. Trees sigh. Fox and rabbit, sparrow and hawk, at peace with each other, watch over the knight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A horse and rider tear through the thick undergrowth. It is Guenevere. The forest races past her as she gallops toward the glade, brambles tearing at her flesh and clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot gets to his feet, tense. Guenevere dismounts and approaches. She is flushed and breathless from the wild race. Her horse, left free, wanders over to his and grazes beside it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She moves closer and he thrusts out his mailed fist to keep her away. She clutches it and presses the metal to her soft tear-streaked cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hungry with passion, she embraces the cold unmoving armor, kissing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps back, drawing his sword. He holds it up by the blade between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And before he can finish she grabs the blade to push it aside. He holds it fast. Blood streams from her bare hands. He cannot prevail without cutting them deeply. He lets go of the sword, and she lets it fall to the ground. She embraces his still and defeated hulk. She kisses the metal, and sensation shoots through him, dizzying him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He folds her in his arm, and their bodies lock together as though a trap had sprung. Their mouths meet, each devouring the other...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why? You will destroy Arthur, and us...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The law forbids it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Love demands it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There are things about love--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --Nothing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By my knight's sword, I swore faith--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guenevere...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Merlin, the King desperate, the Wizard overwhelmed by compassion:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur looks up and in the rolling clouds maybe, just maybe, the form of a dragon is taking shape. Arthur draws Excalibur, intensity animating his dead features.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They embrace. Merlin is on the verge of tears, his face immediately sad and finally ancient. Arthur exits. Morgana, who has been watching from the shadows, watching from the shadows, slinks up to Merlin's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin smiles knowingly at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He reaches to touch her lips. She cradles his hand in hers and doesn't allow Merlin to kiss her. She kisses his knuckles and stares into his eyes, stoking his desire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She breaks away, provocative, alluring.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I am alone and betrayed. By my wife, by my beloved friend, by my knights. And by you. Perhaps most of all by you. For you made me, you forged this wretched life. And like a child tired of a toy, you toss me aside, a babbling lecher trotting after my sister...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is my destiny. I have a destiny, too...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With all your powers, you are content to be ridiculed, laughed at...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My powers fade, Arthur. I resort to cheap tricks... (with sudden enthusiasm) Yes! I enjoy every moment of my foolishness, I join in the making of it, so no one can betray me. But you! You betray yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me? I have lived by the oath of king and knight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You betray the boy who drew the sword, the boy who saw the Dragon... the Dragon who moves close by, coiling and uncoiling, restless, looking down, waiting for the King to be a king...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I must do it myself. I must kill them both. Lancelot and Guenevere. Will you ride with me, Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot. I must not. Here I must stay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Crazy old fool. You think yourself a kingmaker. Ha! A meddler, more likely. Look what a mess you've made of things.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ? Perhaps, perhaps. I'm losing interest, Morgana... I have helped men--or meddled in their affairs, if you would have it that way--since the dawn of time. Now let them live by their own laws. Let them stand on their own feet. The gods of once are gone forever, it is time for men... Morgana, make a man out of me. Kiss me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know what I want. I want the secret of true magic, how to thicken the stuff of dreams and wishes with the flesh of the world.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That I cannot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then I will not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Sir Kay gallop through the forest, silently. It is not a dream.  Their armor and the hooves of their horses are muffled with pieces of cloth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only Nature will ever see their love; the creatures of the air, tree and ground witness the final reality of their passion and sense its unfathomable depths, singing of it in a hundred languages. Lancelot and Guenevere are naked and interlocked, one being, suspended in the darkness in the eye of the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur walks soundlessly through the trees, approaching the glade. The forest falls suddenly silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All passion spent, locked in each other's arms, Lancelot and Guenevere drift off into sleep. Arthur comes upon them. He stands over them. He draws Excalibur. Checking all emotion, he holds it above his head. The ancient steel glows darkly. The lovers faces are serene and innocently beautiful. He hesitates, tormented. His mask of anguish gives way to determination and calm. He strikes the sword home, letting go of it. He backs away, turns and disappears into the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky is red; so is the steel of Excalibur. Lancelot awakens and starts at what he sees. His cry stirs Guenevere. They are horrified to see Excalibur impaled in the ground between their entwined bodies. It has pierced their union without grazing their flesh. They leap up and back away, unable to speak at first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She kneels before the sword, embracing the hilt to her breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lancelot stumbles into the forest, berserk with guilt. He rages against a small tree, crying out, and he rips its roots from the ground, the terrible tearing and renting the symbol of his own inner torment. Guenevere sinks to the ground next to Lancelot's empty armor and his abandoned sword.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't he kill us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He has given up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The King without his sword, the land without a king...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are to blame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Merlin and Morgana descend winding steps cut out of rock. The only light comes from the glow of Merlin's staff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans close to her ear, whispering into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is about to kiss her when he slips. He laughs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When Arthur built the castle, I carved out a place for myself, where I could laugh or sleep, and no one would bother me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: People make you laugh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They don't know how close they live to the edge of delight or disas...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Happiness or horror.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They pass through jaws of stalactites and stalagmites. Merlin cracks his staff whip-like and a ball of fire billows up from the tip and illuminates a cave wildly veined and filigreed with minerals and crusted with growths of crystals. The light goes out but the malachite and the gold, the quartz, diamond and beryllium burn dully. He turns to her, suddenly tall and unstooped, younger, sleek and evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sweeps her up into his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He deposits her on bare rock. He kisses her. She pushes him away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She leans forward and kisses his ear and whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She draws closer, kissing him deeply. He breathes heavily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morgana falls silent as Merlin raises a hand, majestically intoning a harsh repetitive charm. The mineral veins of the cave begin to glow and fog seeps out from them enveloping the couple.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morgana burns with intensity. Merlin utters a formula and the fog coalesces around them into the shimmering presence of crystal walls, fountains raining jewels, flowers made of scented air, a bed of glass shot with light and covered with skins of animals dead before the time of man, goblets of ruby, tapestries woven of golden hair. She reaches out to touch the wall and her hand plunges through the unmaterialized illusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She begins lacing up her loosened gown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She does, a mad hope in her eyes. She kisses his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He utters the ancient charm, Morgana listening closely, memorizing it. The illusion is all of a sudden solid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She runs her hand across the hard crystal surface, her eyes gleaming. From outside the wondrous room they can be seen to embrace. He carries her to the magical bed where he makes love to her, as they disappear from view in its effulgent light. She comes out through the crystal door, burning with evil intent. She turns to watch him asleep in the bed. She utters the charm of Summoning learnt from Merlin, and the room melts into an eddying carmine fog. Within it, Merlin struggles to awaken from the torpor of love, alarmed. Outside, Morgana utters the charm of Making and the gaseous mass begins to crystallize. Inside, Merlin is rising to his feet, breathing the red fog, his movements slowing to a standstill, his mouth opening in a scream of horror. The cloud has metamorphosed into a magnificent cluster of red crystals.  Morgana peers into its facets and there she sees, in fragments, Merlin's terror... an eye, the gaping mouth, a clawing hand--as he is entombed in the stone. She laughs in triumph.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: In the folds of the earth where the forces that hold the world together are more alive, my power is strongest. Here I will possess you, as a man possesses a woman. And the god, the eunuch, the mule that I was, will be no more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are truly magnificent!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Flattery! Do you think I am ignorant of your stupid little games? Preying on you weakness of others. That's your power, a petty evil. Mine is great. Great plans. Impossible dreams. Laughable endings...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merlin, the powers of Summoning, the true Name of the charms of Doing and Undoing. Show me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't. You would misuse such power. I have paid enough for you, and I will have you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make magic, my foolish wizard. For our love. Weave a marvelous room around us, a room worthy of our coupling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you want? You must desire it for me to weave it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Walls of shining crystals, burning with red fire, furnishings of metals and jewels never seen by man...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Desire it and it will be as you desire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's only a semblance. You disappoint me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't touch the walls. Come close to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do it, Merlin, the deepest secret. Fix it with the charm of Making, for our endless pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: For you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Surrounded by forest, the spires and battlements of Camelot rise under black storm clouds. Arthur and Kay ride back to the castle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The great hall is in gloom. Few knights are in attendance at the table. Some sleep off last night's wine. Arthur approaches, haggard, searching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knights look up; those who meet Arthur's reddened eyes shake their heads. Arthur leaves. A knight whispers to another.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Has no one seen Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you see? The King was without Excalibur...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Echoing in the vaulted corridors outside the hall, the knight's whisper stabs Arthur. The words now seem borne on the whistling wind and follow the King wherever he goes in search of Merlin. He comes upon a knight seducing a lady in a dark corner by the chapel door, his hand under her gown. Arthur notes the sacrilege in silence, and continues on his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind keens. Thunder rolls overhead. Arthur enters his bedchamber. He sits by the empty fireplace, a broken man. Feminine hands light on his shoulders. He starts. He looks up. It is Morgana. He smiles and grasps her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She comes around and she kneels in front of him. Before he can talk she silences him with a tender caress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She begins untying the laces of his metal thigh and shin guards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is stripping his legs naked, gently touching the flesh with her fingertips. He stares off, remembering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur's eyes brim with tears. Morgana weeps, embracing his knees. He rests his hand gently upon her head, choked with remembrance, soothing her. But as she weeps, she incants a charm. Arthur looks down upon her, and the woman who looks up at him is Guenevere, a Guenevere with cold ice eyes. He is made weak by desire and weakened further by magic. He holds her face adoringly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She draws him to the floor and upon her body, holding him tightly to himself. Arthur trembles with excitement, pathetic in his desperate passion. As he takes her, she shudders, losing control of the charm, and her features change till once again "Guenevere" is Morgana. She holds him in a tight embrace so that he may not see her. She whispers in his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur wrenches himself away so he can see her, her arms still around his neck. He looks down upon her, aghast, incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She presses her thumbs into his neck and he faints.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'll weep for you, brother, for a King must not weep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know what Guenevere's maids have whispered?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That when the King returned from battle...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Guenevere would unlace his armor and massage the burns where metal rubbed on flesh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...She would prepare a bath for you, mixing special ointment in the water...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guenevere! You are--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --Don't speak. A thousand words, a hundred thousand words, would only be prologue to the truth that must be. That you, King, and I, your Queen, beget a son to bond our love and to strengthen our weak kingdom with a successor. Come, my lord...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The moon flows in my blood to meet your seed. And already I bear him who will be King.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could easily kill you, brother. But I want you to live to see our son be King. In me, the blood of Cornwall will have its revenge; in me, the blood of Uther will show its dark side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Morgana, with a small party, rides away from the castle through the lashing storm, till they are taken from sight in the folds of the forest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lightening forks across the sky, illuminating the interior. The chapel has been transformed into a place of satanic worship. Held up and surrounded by hooded figures, Morgana lies on the altar, her pregnant belly huge; and her features are fierce with passionate intensity. She writhes in the pangs of childbirth.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stand back, all of you. Through my own body I have nurtured him with my potions. I made him. I alone can give him life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur enters, pale and haunted. Mass is being celebrated, and some knights are present. Those not asleep whisper to each other about the King. The sound of an approaching storm is heard. As the priest raises the chalice to consecrate the wine. Arthur comes down the aisle and steps onto the altar. He reaches out to grasp the chalice from the priest's hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morgana holds aloft her beautiful newborn baby, his body glistening in a flash of lightening. She is triumphant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . A bolt of lightening strikes the chalice, rocking the chapel, and Arthur is knocked back violently. Rain lashes in through the shattered window upon the terrified knights. They and the priest back away. Arthur is left alone. He rises and goes to the chalice, which is bent and cracked. He kneels before it. Steam hisses up as rain falls on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sun streams in. Many of the knights are in attendance, in full armor. Ladies and pages watch from dark corners. Arthur addresses the fellowship. He holds the cracked chalice in his hands. He burns with a new-found fervor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gawain rises and draws his sword in salute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval, Kay and a few others draw their swords and touch their lips to the blades in oath. Sunbeams splash off their armor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rest of the fellowship draw their swords in imitation, but the resolution within them is not strong. Arthur comes forward to Gawain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He embraces Gawain, tears in his eyes. He turns to Perceval, and Perceval kneels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur kisses the young knight's brow. Then he turns to Kay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Kay watch the knights file out till the hall is empty, the harsh song of their armor growing distant.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who will ride the labyrinths of the forest, to the very root of his soul, to the very ends of the earth, to find the secret that will redeem us from the evil that has fallen upon us, and make this chalice, and ourselves, whole again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will ride forth in the name of that quest, and commit my strength and my soul to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gawain, a dreadful fear is upon me, that we may never meet again, that the fellowship will be no more...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We will find the secret or die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Kay, I know your heart yearns to go, but I am prisoner to my duties, and you must be to yours, at my side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : "For nine years they searched. Morgana's power grew in the land."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under a leaden sky, Gawain drives his horse through swirling snow. He comes upon a mounted knight who is frozen in his tracks. He brushes the snow from the man's face. The frozen features belong to Caradoc. He slowly continues on his way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dangling from the branches of a dead tree are a dozen dead knights of the Round Table, crows pecking at the rotting flesh in the chinks of armor. Perceval rides up, cries out in horror, and spurs his horse away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rotting carcasses of sheep. The crops blackened and withered on the stalk. Hungry peasants head for a distant hill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A giant head has been carved out of an outcrop of rock, its stone mouth gaping toward the sky. People are congregated around the mouth. Peasants and farmers, they are wild with excitement, responding to drums throbbing and bagpipes wailing. They watch Morgana, who is surrounded by knights in dark armor. At her side is an angelic boy of eight, his eyes cold as his mother's. Morgana is more beautiful than ever, in flowing druidic robes, the gossamer silk clinging to her sweat-drenched body. She is standing by the deep hole which forms the giant's open mouth. It is covered by a tooth-like grating acting as a drain for the blood of human sacrifices made there. Before her is Gawain, chained and struggling against five strong men who hold him. Morgana lifts a dagger and plunges it into Gawain's chest. The fountain of blood that gushes from the great knight's body drives the crowd into a frenzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gawain, his blood flowing from him and into the giant's mouth, looks up in anguish. His bellowing voice is echoed and amplified by the hollow beneath the drain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (intoning) The blood of this knight will feed the god in the earth, he is weak with hunger, and he will be made strong by this blood. Then he will plant his seed, and the land will be fertile once again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Arthur, forgive me. I die without the secret. I have failed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Gawain's death cry and the din of the ritual carries to Perceval's ears as he wanders through the wasteland. He draws down his visor and spurs his horse forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He gallops toward the giant's head. He checks his sword and lowers his lance. The knight charging forward on his war horse is an awesome sight, but the crowd around the giant's mouth is strangely unfrightened. Morgana is excited; she turns to the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval is galloping toward them when the ground gives way beneath the horse, and he and the animal plunge into a pit. The cheering crowd rushes to the edge of the trap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her knights drag Perceval, unarmed, into Morgana's presence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval doesn't answer, defiant and hiding his fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holding Perceval by his limbs and hair, the men force him down on the bloody grating, drawing back his head, exposing his throat. Morgana kneels by his head, and draws the boy beside her. She holds the tip of the dagger to Perceval's neck and takes Mordred's hand and wraps it around the handle. Perceval is choked with fear, his heart pounding in his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy looks up at his mother. The vein in Perceval's neck pushes against the dagger's point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy raises the dagger, and hesitates just a bit. Perceval resigns himself bravely. He looks the child calmly in the eye. Mordred brings down the blade without strength, just piercing the skin with the tip. He lets go of the dagger, afraid now of his mistake. The dagger clatters to the grating and slips away down the drain, before Morgana can retrieve it. She rages against Mordred. In the confusion, Perceval tears loose, the men holding him slipping on the blood-wet stone. Perceval runs through the crowd. Immediately, lance lowered, a knight is upon him. Perceval leaps toward him, catching the lance in his hand, and pulling down the rider with it. He jumps the rider and draws the knight's sword. Whirling the lance and cutting the air with the sword, he keeps back the other knights for a moment, giving him time to see his chance. He leaps onto the riderless horse and charges off through the crowd. He reins in abruptly, the horse rearing. He is wary of the ground before him; there could be a hidden pit. But there is no time to think. Knights and men on foot are rushing him. He spurs forward into a gallop, the horse striding mightily And its hind leg sinks into a pit, the animal losing its gait. But the momentum carries the horse forward, and it recovers from the stumble. Perceval gallops away. Morgana is enraged. She shakes Mordred by the hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But suddenly she begins kissing him tenderly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just stands there emotionless, the dead center of her turbulent passions.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Look, Mordred, a true prize for the giant. The lamb rides into our jaws.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Mordred) You must kill him, for this knight is dear to your father. You must do it and learn to enjoy your father's pain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you found what you search for? Have you found what Arthur seeks?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You haven't, or you would be smiling now in the face of death. Your quest is an impossible one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That it might be impossible makes it all the more necessary.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fool! (to the men holding Perceval) Uncover him. I'll show you the mystery of life. It's death... (to Mordred) Do it, Mordred!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Feel the life through the dagger, child. It belongs to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel it, Mother. I will give his blood to the giant.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You didn't kill him! You didn't kill him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My dear, sweet boy...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Perceval gallops down a trail. The black-armored knights of Morgana chase him. Perceval reins into deep cover alongside the trail. The pursuers thunder past and the sound of hooves recedes. Perceval checks his newly found sword, slashes the air to feel the weapon's balance. He re-sheathes it. He pats the horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts off again, into the patchless forest of dead trees. He is suddenly set upon by a wildman who, swinging a small uprooted tree, knocks him off his horse. Perceval crashes to the ground and before he can use his sword the wildman has knocked it out of his hand. It is Lancelot, demented, who furiously rains battering blows on Perceval's armor, bellowing with rage. All that Perceval can do is attempt to avoid the blows. Lancelot addresses Perceval as if the young knight were Lancelot himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before Perceval can speak, Lancelot disappears again into the forest, his eyes blank, as though his encounter with the young knight had never happened. A knot of pain, Perceval pulls himself up. He tries to rise into the saddle. He is too hurt to do it. He starts off on foot, slowly, leading the horse.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We'll become good friends.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you going, Lancelot, in your iron tomb? Still trying to save the world? (He hammers blows into Perceval's armor) The best... the bravest... the greatest... fool that ever lived. Now the world rots. Death is king of the earth. And it is you who make it so, Lancelot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is very dark and Perceval has to feel his way. He comes to the edge of a stream. He kneels to drink, and the horse drinks beside him. Then he rests back on his heels, brooding, too tired to rise. He lowers his eyes, staring into the dark water, defeated, empty. Before him in the water a long thin bar of light appears. He looks at it amazed. Voices are heard singing very far away. He reaches out to touch the long strip of light but his hand just disturbs the water. It is a reflection. The strip grows wider and the ethereal music is closer. Perceval looks up. The strip of light is before him, suspended, thirty feet above. It continues to grow wider. A drawbridge is being slowly lowered, allowing a powerful light to escape from within. Perceval is terrified. In pain, he slowly rises into the saddle, ready to gallop off; but fascinated, hypnotized by the sight, he cannot, and he stays and watches. The dim outline of a castle becomes visible as the drawbridge is lowered across the water to the ground at his feet. At the center of the blast of light coming from the castle, Perceval can make out a burning chalice. The music swells to a terrifying pitch, searing the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the sight of the chalice, Perceval masters his fear. Bathed in light and music, he spurs the horse forward onto the drawbridge. Once he is on it, the bridge begins to rise. Unsure of its footing and blinded by the light, the horse becomes skittish, and Perceval has to struggle to control it. He dismounts to lead it, but the horse is terrified, rears up and jumps off the bridge, which continues to rise, drawn up by unseen hands. Perceval hesitates, then advances down the sloping drawbridge into the castle courtyard. All details are bleached out by the blinding light. The chalice appears suspended in space, and now the figure of a man can be glimpsed standing behind it. Enchanting music from unseen singers grows and weaves. Perceval looks back to see the drawbridge slowly closing, trapping him inside. He approaches the figure, his courage ebbing. Hands cupping the chalice, it speaks to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval doesn't understand. He glances back again. The drawbridge is nearly closed. Terror seizes him. Panicked, puzzled, baffled, he backs away. He scrambles up the drawbridge desperate to reach the top before it closes. He claws his way up till his hand grasps the top. He heaves himself through the narrow closing slit which is about to crush him. He screams, and with a final effort he wriggles free and topples over crashing into the water below.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is the secret of the chalice? Who does it serve?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He looks up. The drawbridge thunders shut, the last thin strip of light disappearing; and now he is surrounded only by the silence of the forest. Where there was a castle, now there is darkness. Perceval wades through the water. He has crossed the stream and all he can see and feel are tree trunks. The castle has disappeared. He is utterly defeated.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The chalice. The secret was in my grasp. I let it slip, afraid for myself. A question was asked. I didn't understand. I didn't try. I failed...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: : "Nine years passed."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dripping water is steadily encrusting the crystal with limestone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead knights lay on biers. The once glorious seat of power is falling into decay. Few are in attendance around the table. Agitated, Kay enters and goes to Arthur, who is worn and haggard, and aged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur comes alive.
direction.name: direction

location: HALL OF THE ROUND TABLE, CAMELOT
result.heading: INT.

dialogue.raw_text: Your son Mordred is at the gate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At last...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't recognize him. You were trapped by Morgana's sorcery.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (staring off) ...Gawain and Perceval, Bors and Bohort, Caradoc and Ector, and all the others--lost to me. Only the echo of their voices remains in this empty hall. All I have left is the memory of their fellowship. Echoes and memories. I am a ghost of the King that once was... (he turns to Kay and with sudden harshness) ...Mordred is real, alive, my own flesh and blood. I will see him, I must.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The drawbridge lowers slowly, and Arthur moves away from Kay and the other knights, and advances across it. Rooks wheel over the dead trees of the forest that surrounds Camelot. A group of armed men waits at the edge of the forest. One steps forward, a huge knight in black armor, the metal defining and exaggerating the powerful musculature of his body. He is Mordred, a young man of eighteen, and of extraordinary beauty. A page follows ten steps behind him bearing an enormous spear, its points hooded. Arthur stops at the edge of the drawbridge, the huge knight a few steps from him. Kay, ready for anything, moves halfway across the drawbridge. Mordred kneels on one knee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He points to the huge lance. The page pulls a string and the hood drops, revealing a diabolically sharp spear tip, its metal glinting menacingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mordred is thrown off by the doubt Arthur has cast. Arthur looks upon his son, desperately trying to read him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur goes forward to embrace his son, a desperate attempt. Mordred recoils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur is on the verge of tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns and re-enters the castle, the drawbridge pulled up immediately behind him. He is hunched over, broken.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Father...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rise, Mordred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have come to claim what is mine, Father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I recognize you only as my son, no more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (his tone is scathing) And you are the great King? The lords have rebelled. Invaders attack the coasts. Crops don't grow. There is nothing but plague and hunger in the land. Only I am feared. I will be king. You may have lost Excalibur, but I have found my own weapon of power. There.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The very spear that pierced the side of Christ as he died on the cross.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your mother told you that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot offer you the land, only my love...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I offer only this, Father. To commit with passion and pleasure all the evils that you failed to commit, as man and king.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We will embrace only in battle. Father, and I will touch you only with the blade of my spear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will muster a great force of knights, and I will return to fight for what is mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So be it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Asleep in the saddle, Perceval rides across burnt and smoldering fields. The horse walks aimlessly; it is the same animal, mangy and old. A hoard of children in filthy rags closes in on him, begging, pulling at the horse's trappings. He bolts awake and reins away. His eyes are red and feverish. Wild hope grips him when he sees a glinting light by a farmhouse. He spurs the horse forward into a gallop.
direction.name: direction
