direction.raw_text: He leaps from the saddle and a terrified woman backs away. Perceval plunges his hand into the source of light. It is nothing but the reflection of the dying sun in a bucketful of water. Perceval covers his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peasants have emerged, surrounding him, and they hold axes and pitchforks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At least ten peasants encircle Perceval and he is too exhausted to put up a fight. They grab him and carry him away. Other peasants pull his horse to the ground, and one raises and ax to kill it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Illusions. I will never find it again... I am sorry, woman, that I frightened you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good woman, do you have any food? Some water?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The little we had, we gave to Mordred's knights. He has taken this land. Tell the King that now we must look to Mordred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But we will give you some water...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They throw Perceval down an escarpment and he rolls into the fast-moving water. He is swept downstream and thrown ferociously against the rocks in the stream bed, crying out in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER AND UNDERWATER - EVENING The water is deeper and Perceval is dragged under by the weight of his armor. He struggles desperately to shed it, half drowning. Exhausted, he pulls himself up onto the muddy shore beside a rotting sheep carcass, and around him, the daylight dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ragged and bruised, lifeless, he stares into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A light bursting through the trees shines on the mud, wordless, harmonies sound somewhere in the forest. Perceval sets off toward the source. The burning light blasts into his face but he doesn't flinch. The chorus builds in power. Before him, a drawbridge lowers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have lost my horse, my armor, my sword. I have lost my way. I have lost my strength. I have lost everything... I will not lose hope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He steps onto the bridge and walks in. He crosses the courtyard as the drawbridge closes behind him. All details of the castle are bleached out by the searing light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He steps onto the bridge and walks in. He crosses the courtyard as the drawbridge closes behind him. All details of the castle are bleached out by the searing light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heading for the source of the light he ascends what seem to be a staircase. He enters a hall where the chalice stands suspended, burning with light, and the mysterious music swirls and grows. Perceval approaches the diaphanous and featureless Figure who stands over the chalice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval cups his hands around the chalice to lift it. But they close on nothing, and he draws back. The Figure's hands, although insubstantial, grasp Perceval's and appear to hold his hands around the cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval begins to kneel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The blinding light vanishes, the music drifts away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who does it serve?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You, my lord.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have waited long for you. Once you almost saw, but fear blinded you. Why am I served from the chalice?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you and the land are one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am wasting away and I cannot die. And I cannot live.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You and the land are one. Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn and the land with you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But who am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are my lord and King. You are Arthur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Perceval falls to his knees before Arthur and he holds the chalice, now whole again, up to the King. It fills with blood from within and Arthur takes it from Perceval. He drinks. And having done so, he seems to become younger and to grow in strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir Kay stands by the vast fireplace where a small fire burns, and only now looks up and is aware of Perceval.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know how empty was my soul until it was filled.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Perceval, you have returned!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ready my knights for battle; they will ride with their King once more. I have lived through others far too long! Lancelot carried my honor and Guenevere my guilt. My knights have fought my causes. Mordred carries my sins. Now, at last, I will rule.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur at the head of a small force of knights, their armor shining beneath the moon, gallops through the land. Where hooves thunder, the ground becomes alive with sprouts and tendrils, and bare trees start to bud, and grasses to blossom, the power of Nature exploding into life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An old nun approaches the doors, upon which someone is pounding loudly. She opens the peephole. It is Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The old nun is amazed and starts pushing open the many bolts, mumbling and agitated.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go away. No man is allowed beyond these doors.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am Arthur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She leads the King, his footsteps ringing in the silent cloister, past the doors to the cells. His armor is wet with dew and it shines with a dull and deep luster. Nuns whisper at his transit. She opens the door to a cell and Arthur steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Candles flicker on a small altar before which a nun is praying. She turns to see who has entered. It is Guenevere, older, thin with self-denial, all the more beautiful. She looks up at the majestic figure who stands before her. She nearly swoons. He helps her to her feet, and words rush from deep within him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She weeps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She draws back the covers of her pallet, and there is Excalibur. Arthur is overwhelmed by emotion; he can barely speak
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kneels before her and kisses her thigh. She gazes off, remembering the life of long ago. He rises and looks off into her eyes, unable to find the words; he finally does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes Excalibur by the hilt and exits.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Guenevere, accept my forgiveness, and put your heart to rest. We have suffered to long. I have always loved you, and I still love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I loved you much, as King, and sometimes as husband, but one cannot gaze too long at the sun in the sky.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forgive me, my wife, if you can. I was not born to live a man's life, but to be the stuff of future memory. The fellowship was a brief beginning, a fair time that cannot be forgotten; and because it will not be forgotten, that fair time may come again. Now once more I must ride with my knights to defend what was, and the dream of what could be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have kept it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I never dared to hope all these years that it was in your keeping.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have often thought that in the hereafter of our lives, when I owe no more to the future and can be just a man, that we may meet, and you will come to me and claim me as yours, and know that I am your husband. It is a dream I have...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The nuns scatter before him in awe and terror. He strides forward, Excalibur in hand. He stops and tests its balance, and he draws force from it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Guenevere...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Excalibur gleams in the sunlight. Arthur holds it high, at the head of a small force of knights under the banner of the Dragons. Kay and Perceval ride at his side. Plumed helmets, shields blazing with armorial colors, pennants flying in the clean wind from their lances; it is a brave sight. The trees are in blossom and dandelion fluff billows up at their passage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur's group comes to a halt. Two knights and a few squires galloping from the opposite direction rein in before the King. The knights draw their swords in homage, and the older one addresses Arthur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur smiles hiding the hurt. He points to an open pit, a huge devastation.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is only me and my son. All other knights of the dukedom have rallied to Mordred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What horror is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mordred, sir. He digs for precious metals, with which he buys the loyalty of men at arms, binding them to his side.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is a clear night and the sky blazes with stars. A crescent moon casts its silvery light upon Arthur, who wanders from his camp alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops in the ancient circle of Druidic stones.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He falls on his knees in front of the stone, tired, between thinking and dreaming, and he bangs his mailed fist against it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I am outnumbered ten to one by Mordred's forces. Merlin, I need you at my side as you were once, my friend, to give me courage. There are no war tricks that will fool Mordred. He was weaned on blood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: More than I ever did, I need you now. Where are you, Merlin? Is it true that Morgana has trapped you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The veins of crystal glow darkly, and the hammering of Arthur's fist upon the stone is dimly echoed here. In the red crystal, fragments of Merlin can be glimpsed, trapped, frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur slips off into sleep. The stones around him distort. He speaks softly, but then though the words continue, his lips are closed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...If only you could be at my side, Merlin, to see me wield Excalibur once more...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The crystal is cracking, shards falling to the cave floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur is still on his knees, and he sits back, looking up. But the atmosphere is different, within a dream, and the stones of the henge loom larger over him now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A hand ruffles the King's hair. He turns, and is face to face with Merlin, standing over him. Arthur looks at him without surprise, as though the intervening years never were. Merlin begins to laugh his hideous giggle. Arthur rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He limps affectedly and stretches with exaggerated pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin smiles, turns and leaves, heading for Arthur's camp, giggling. Arthur starts off after him and awakens from the dream when he walks into one of the stones. It takes him a moment to realize that Merlin has vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hurries away toward the camp.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What is this place? It is rumored Merlin, that you drew your power from these circles...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet. You'll wake the men, and they must fight tomorrow for their very lives.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know. I have heard noises and echoes through the stones...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this place, Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is like a tree. The roots of the stones spread out across the land and they draw on the thoughts and actions of men. Like sap those human matters course through the stones feeding the stars that are the leaves of the tree. And the stars whisper back to men the future course of events. (becoming passionate) But the earth is being torn apart, its metals stolen, and the balance is broken and the lines of power no longer converge. In fact, I nearly didn't make it in one piece.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But, I'm here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where have you been these many years? Is it true that Morgana--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --Stories... You brought me back. Your love brought me back. Back to where you are now, in the land of dreams...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is this a dream? Tell me, Merlin!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Merlin?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur shakes Kay awake, and as the faithful knight comes out of a deep sleep, he clutches Arthur's arm.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Merlin, will I live...? (he shakes away the dream) ...I was dreaming...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes. He spoke to me. He said I would fight bravely tomorrow. I have never dreamed of Merlin before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I dreamed of him too... Merlin lives! He lives in our dreams now, in that dark and shadowy place that is as strong and real as this more solid one. He speaks to us from there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Cape flowing, Merlin sweeps between Mordred's war tents, and in the logic of dreams, unseen by the guards. He passes a tent where the huge shadow of Mordred is thrown on the canvas, as he sharpens the blade of a fearsome spear. He enters a tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is stunningly beautiful in her sleep. Merlin leans over her lovely body, kisses her softly on the lips, and waits for her to awaken.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I have returned, enchantress. You are beautiful, magnificent. Have you used up all the magic you stole from me to keep yourself young? Have you any magic left to do battle with Merlin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She rises from her sleeping body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Merlin steps back, grandiose and melodramatic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He raises his staff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lowers the staff with dreamlike slowness and she slinks right up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She winds her fluttering hands around the staff, and the shadows they cast upon the tent give the illusion of licking flames.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She laughs at her cleverness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You provoke me, Merlin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's behind that beauty? A wizened, cold-hearted snake.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are a snake about to strike!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I am the staff that drives the snake back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Burning with the fire of desire, I am the flames that consume the staff to ashes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am the cloudburst that quenches the flames.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am the desert, where water disappears--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: am the sea, which covers the desert forever under its weight.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: am the fog and mists that rise up from the sea, escaping...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fog and mist! You couldn't be that. You don't have enough magic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Morgana tosses and mutters in her tormented dream.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...I have the desire and I have the magic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Merlin, huge, magnetic, enfolds Morgana in his cape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he laughs at her, suffocating her. Morgana begins chanting the charm of Making, desperate--
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You are mine at last. I am the sea and you will never escape me. Fog and Mist...!?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and she finishes uttering it in her sleep. Her eyes spring open, and vapors issue from her gaping mouth. She screams and the fog gushes out filling the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fog billows out of the tent, spreading through the camp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fog is rising, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He rises and goes out with the lieutenant.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That cannot be.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is fogbound, the campfires yellow smudges within it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mordred enters his mother's tent.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to the lieutenant) My mother has a sense for such things. She said there would be no fog.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Mordred enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morgana, withered, old, lies dead in the bed, wisps of smoke rising from within her ruptured body.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: ...Mother?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur, with Kay and Perceval, canters through the white fog. They are flanked by a phalanx of knights in silver armor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay draws his sword in salute, elated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spurs forward, while Arthur reins to a halt, watching him disappear. Perceval and a few knights stay behind and surround the King.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahead, the horrible din of joined battle. In the swirling fog, clash of arms follows clash of arms. There is confusion, for each knight is unable to see if he is fighting friend or foe until they are upon each other. The battle becomes a series of vicious duels, a knight in silver armor against a knight in black-burnished armor, just glimpsed in the fog that is alive with the clang of sword on shield, the pounding of hooves, the cries of the dying. Squires drag away their wounded knights, their young faces pale at the sight of the carnage. Kay is unhorsed but picks himself up and mounts a riderless horse, rejoining the combat although he is bleeding.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Kay, you will lead the attack. Perceval, you will stay with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Be cautious, my brother.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In this battle there is one thing I must do, that no one else can. Find Mordred and kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is full day, and the fog blinds with its painful glare. Arthur with Perceval at his side rides through the fog, searching. Perceval takes up a challenge against the King. He unhorses this opponent, piercing him with his lance. He returns to the King's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay is glimpsed fighting on foot, hurt, barely holding his own, but then the sight is hidden in the fog. Kay overcomes his opponent and stops to catch his breath. He is amazed by what he sees. A knight, in old, battle-scarred armor whose pieces don't match, cuts down the knights in black in foray after foray, wheeling and turning in a brilliant and ruthless spectacle of martial arts. He fights without a shield, a lance in his left hand and sword in his right. Kay moves away in search of Arthur. Arthur and Perceval watch the lone knight meting out death with such terrible beauty, weaving in and out of the fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spurs his horse forward to join him, but Perceval is quick to stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kay rises onto a fresh horse and gallops away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There are too many on Mordred's side. We cannot hold out much longer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can be no other.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lancelot?... It is Lancelot!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, my lord. We seek Mordred.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I will join him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Perceval ride alone, the accompanying knights gone, the dying and the dead and the crazed horses all around them. Squires are carrying Kay upon his shield. He is dead. Arthur leaps to the ground and reaches out to touch his face, and closes his eyes. He stifles his tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur rushes off, Perceval following on horseback. Lancelot is mortally wounded, blood flowing from his abdomen, his eyes open but his gaze dead. Arthur falls to his side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But there is no one now except the dead and wounded, and Perceval, who dismounts to watch over the King, sword drawn. Desperate, Arthur stops the wound with his hand. Lancelot's eyes are sightless, but tears spill from them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He tears off a piece of his tunic and staunches the wound with it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arthur takes Lancelot in his arms and rests his lips against the knight's brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He lies, closing his eyes, unable to look at Lancelot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A boyish smile settles over the features of Lancelot's face, and he dies. Arthur holds him to his breast, his eyes shut tight. A strong wind rises. Perceval kneels beside Arthur.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Has anyone seen Lancelot?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He lies over there, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Squire! Here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Arthur.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lancelot, I will save you... Don't die.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My salvation is to die a Knight of the Round Table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are that and much more. You are its greatest knight, you are what is best in men. Now we will be together--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --It is the old wound, that has been opened. I have always known it would be the gateway to my death, for it has never healed. Let my heart do its job, my King, and pump me empty...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (a death whisper) Guenevere, has she come to you, is she Queen again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She is, Lancelot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The fog is lifting. Only we remain alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Arthur and Perceval rise, and as far as they can see across the green hills that roll down to the sea lies the aftermath of the massacre. Hacked bodies, abandoned armor, steaming horse carcasses, everything still. The murmur of the dying is carried on the wind to the soft roar of the sea. The squires have fled the scene of horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Elsewhere on the battlefield, Mordred searches the dead, accompanied only by his lieutenant, who turns over the bodies of Arthur's knights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of Arthur's knights reaches out blindly for help. Mordred crushes his skull underfoot. The shaft of his huge lance is caked with blood, as are his hands. Arthur and Perceval see Mordred and his lieutenant, and the King restrains Perceval from going forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shield on his left arm, and Excalibur in his right, he starts toward Mordred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mordred advances forward, the huge spear in both hands and parallel to the ground. Arthur goes straight for him, shield ready to receive the blow. Mordred keeps walking, his arms now tensed back and ready to strike. Once they are within weapon's reach of each other, Mordred dashes forward and thrusts the spear. It glances off Arthur's shield, slides under his hauberk and penetrates the King's body, and so powerful was the blow that the blade pierces him right through. Mortally wounded, Arthur's scream of pain becomes a horrible war cry, and he drives himself forward with all the strength he has along the spear shaft almost to Mordred's hands. Mordred is knocked back and to the ground and Arthur presses down on him, the butt of the spear pinning Mordred. Arthur lifts Excalibur. Mordred attempts to free himself, as the blade of Excalibur descends upon him and cuts through metal, flesh and bone. Mordred's head falls to the ground, rolling away. Mordred's lieutenant flees. Perceval races to Arthur's side, and supports the King who has fallen on his knees. Arthur speaks through the pain:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval holds the King tight to himself with one arm, while with the other he draws the shaft through and out of Arthur's body. Arthur sags but doesn't fall. Perceval begins to remove his armor to get at the gaping wounds. The King speaks slowly, softly, from outside his own pain-wracked body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval, stunned by the command, doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval picks up the sword, mounts his horse and rides inland. Arthur watches him go, struggling with the pain, still kneeling, and then his head falls to his chest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: But for Mordred. Where is Mordred?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where is Arthur?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, Perceval. Now it is time for me to raise my sword. (he bellows out) Mordred, prepare to meet your death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wait for you, Father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Draw the spear from me. Do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There is one thing left to do... Excalibur... And you must do it, Perceval. Leave my wounds, I command you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I cannot--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --Take Excalibur. Find a pool of calm water and throw the sword into it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Obey me, Perceval. You must act for me. It is my last order as your King. Do it, and be back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Perceval steps through tall reeds to the edge of a pool. He cannot bring himself to throw Excalibur into the water. He examines the blade, and it is haloed with a faint iridescence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He backs away from the water and hides the sword in the reeds, and starts back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It is too precious a thing. I can't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Perceval dismounts, rushing to kneel at the King's side. Arthur looks up, calm and intense.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The King looks at him with piercing power. Perceval blurts it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval leaves once more. The daylight is failing, the sun is near the horizon over the sea, bursting through clouds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: When you threw it in, what did you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...I saw nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My King, I couldn't do it. Excalibur cannot be lost. Other men--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: --By itself it is only a piece of steel. Its power comes from he who wields it. For now there is no one. Do as I have ordered!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He picks up the sword and looks at it for a long time. Finally, with great misgiving, he hurls it into the middle of the pool. As Excalibur is about to touch the water a woman's hand reaches and grasps it by the hilt. It holds the sword aloft for a moment and then draws it under. Perceval backs away from the pool stunned by the marvel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Perceval returns to the King, terribly excited, shouting from his horse:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Arthur isn't there. Perceval looks around him, he doesn't understand. He sees a trail of blood. He spurs his horse and follows the trail down to the sea.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Arthur!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is a trail of blood and prints upon the sand left by a man crawling. Perceval follows them toward the sea. He looks around, searching, terribly distraught. Where the blood and prints cease, there are many footprints coming from and returning into the sea. Perceval looks out across the waves. He sees a sailing vessel rising on the swell. On its deck he can make out the distant figure of Arthur, lying surrounded by women, their gossamer robes rippling in the wind. The sun hovers on the horizon and the ship is heading for it. He gallops into the waves until his horse will go no further, calling out with all his strength, a futile attempt:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun slips below the horizon. Night is falling, and the wind whips the wavecrests. He turns from the sea and wades back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops at the edge of the water. In the uncertain light sky and sea become one. He draws the chalice out of a pouch on his saddle, and he holds it up before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind swirls and whistles mysteriously in the hollow of the cup. Music grand and melancholic grows from it. The chalice, etched in starlight, is the last thing that is taken from sight in the enfolding darkness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Arthur! Will you return?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All the knights of the Round Table are dead. Excalibur is returned. Arthur is gone. Maybe he lives, maybe he will return...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Only I remain, and this...
dialogue.name: dialogue
